pr_title: [#9382] Add numerical question creation example box

timeline.bodyText:
Would be good to follow the defaults created for a new question 
  
    
      teammates/src/web/services/feedback-questions.service.ts
    
    
        Lines 332 to 348
      in
      331faaa
    
    
    
    

        
          
           case FeedbackQuestionType.NUMSCALE:

               questionBrief: '', 
        

        
          
               questionDescription: '',

replies.bodyText: I think it is even better to use the service to generate a template and them fill dummy values such as questionBrief or questionDescription.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
I think it is even better to use the service to generate a template and them fill dummy values such as questionBrief or questionDescription.

You mean create a new method in the service specifically for populating help page data? I like the idea but feel that it's something we can work on after v7?
replies.author: madanalogy

replies.bodyText: It's fine. I am thinking about something else. Just ignore my comment :P
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText:
Just a nit. The order of fields can be more logically (even it does not matter in JavaScript).

Like the customNumberOfEntitiesToGiveFeedbackTo should be together with numberOfEntitiesToGiveFeedbackToSetting.
Form control fields (isEditable, isSaving) can be separated from the actual form fields.
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: Reordered fields for all question model for readability.
replies.author: Derek-Hardy

timeline.bodyText: Let's just follow the convention in other PR by not subscribing to the change event (i.e. There is no need to have the () (the banana syntax)).
timeline.author: xpdavid
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -162,7 +162,9 @@
